channel.title: I need a new camera....what do you think about this?
channel.description:
Ever since we got back from Jamaica, I can't find my digital camera anywhere. So, with my Christmas money I thought I would buy myself a new one. I really don't want to spend over $100 and MITB doesn't really know a lot about which ones are the best. I found this one on newegg.com and really like it
http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16830111314
We also went to Best Buy and I got to see one in person and still liked it. Do you think this would be a reliable camera?

item.title: I need a new camera....what do you think about this?
item.dc:creator: @srt8 srt8

[quote=“T4_, post:7, topic:322390”][quote author=srt8 link=topic=418789.msg3079404#msg3079404 date=1262053490]
I ended up buying the camera from Overstock, along with an 8gb microSD card.
[/quote]
Elaborate on your experiences once you receive said products.[/quote]

Yes, sir!

Read full topic

item.title: I need a new camera....what do you think about this?
item.dc:creator: @srt8 srt8
item.description:
@srt8 wrote:

The Olympus from newegg.com has Digital Image Stabilization. Is that the same thing?

The one from Overstock has Electronic Image Stabilization.

Read full topic
item.source: I need a new camera....what do you think about this?

item.title: I need a new camera....what do you think about this?
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Does it have shake stabilization? I find the cheap point and shoots have really slow response times (the time it takes from when you press the button to the time the picture is actually captured) which can lead to lots of blurry pictures.

Read full topic
